definition: to receive/to accept/to suffer/subjected to/to bear/to stand/pleasant/(passive marker)
to hold/to grasp/to support/to maintain/to persevere/to manage/to run (i.e. administer)/to control

sentences.english: And I vow to fathom the Tathagata's true meaning.
sentences.chinese: 我今見聞得受持，願解如來真實義。

sentences.english: Receiving the heart of brahma net sutra in jizulutos mountain .
sentences.chinese: 雞足蓮花山金剛塔座受持梵網經菩薩心地法門品。

sentences.english: Nowadays people observe only four Uposatha in a month.
sentences.chinese: 而現今的人們每個月只受持四個布薩日而已。

sentences.english: Take a stick and swirl the rainbow pattern of an oily film on a puddle.
sentences.chinese: 受持小棍子攪動水坑裏的油漬映射出的彩虹圖案。

sentences.english: The Medicine Master Sutra mentions about the benefits of learning and practicing the eight precepts.
sentences.chinese: 藥師經指示受持八關齋戒的利益。

sentences.english: The (number of) years since receiving the commandments.
sentences.chinese: 受持具足戒之後的年數。

sentences.english: The eternal existence of Dharma relies on the observation of Vinaya disciplines by Buddhists.
sentences.chinese: 佛法能否永存取決於佛教徒的受持戒律。

definition: (of a deity) to take a material shape/to appear
Kṣitigarbha Bodhisattva, the Bodhisattva of the Great Vow (to save all souls before accepting Bodhi)/also translated Earth Treasury, Earth Womb, or Earth Store Bodhisattva
Dharma (the teachings of the Buddha)/Buddhist doctrine
the Three Pillars of Faith (Buddha, dharma, sangha)/see also 三寶|三宝[san1 bao3]
incantation (Sanskrit: dharani)/religious chant (promoting virtue and obstructing evil)
the Nirvana sutra: every living thing has Buddha nature.
